info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 08 at 11:10AM PST until December 08 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT... -For the Winter Weather Advisory, wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. -For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy wet snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 9 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph with blowing snow resulting in reduced visibilities. Blowing snow is expected to be the main concern with this event. * WHERE... -For the Advisory, backcountry portions around Klamath Basin, except for a small section of highway 97 north of Chiloquin. -For the Winter Storm Watch, All areas in the Klamath Basin, including Klamath Falls and all major roadways. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The main hazard driving the Winter Storm Watch is the combination of snow amount and the potential for blowing snow to lead to reduced visibility. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
